bow: mil always wanting xmas at her house how do change our tradition ok so we re new family my son is and my daughter is 18 months we ve been going to mil house for christmas and every year she asks me to give her an idea list of toys for the kids she does this for bdays too no problem she wants to buy and we re kind of poor so it win win except she never buys anything off of my list she buys obnoxious age inappropriate toys plastic crap stay home with the kids and ve put lot of thought into my lists each time and each time have to hold back my disappointment and anger with her inconsideration we ve also set up 529 savings plan for our kids and they have deposited one penny she always opts for useless toys instead of their future feel like she just looks and me and my husband as children as well she gets to feed her shopping addiction get all the credit for santa coming to her house and gets to snub me and make me powerless ll admit way to passive and nice and do want to cause any negative feelings towards the holidays or myself am just ungrateful should just shrug it off kind of dreading this christmas and how do address the college savings plan my family when was baby used to travel to my grandmother for xmas until kid number appeared then it became much more sensible for her to come to us if you re happy to host recommend saying that with two children it does make sense to all go over there when they could come to you and then stick to your guns gift is chosen by the giver you accept it and thank them if they ask give them list of stuff that the kids do care that much about and have santa leave the stuff you want to give them at your house you ca force them to put money into the kids college accounts tbh think it would be quite rude to even ask also think it kind of late in the year to change the tradition for this christmas but while you are there you could talk about having them come to you next year agree just find it passive aggressive on her end to act like have say in what she buys what comes into my home then acts like we never even had the conversation makes me wonder if she has something against me we re very pleasant to eachother ve always thanked her and never straight up asked for money for their college just feel she being selfish in way idk justnomil will give you the best advice someone gave me when was getting married you ca change the behavior of other adults only how you react to it you know this is how she is so give up on hoping she suddenly going to behave differently stop sending her lists she wo use tell her sure they ll love whatever you pick out then do what you want with the gifts stop going there for christmas tell her you re changing traditions and the family wants to spend christmas at home with santa coming to their own house invite her if you want or see her later that day another day part of being an adult and parent is learning to stop caring about other people approval especially our parents you have family of your own now do what works for them and if anyone gets butthurt over it that their problem there are some great books about setting boundaries do celebrate christmas at her house do it at yours tell her to either buy from your list or be rejected from next christmas onwards before this talk about this with your husband you need to be on the same page both of you need to be present when you talk to her the alternative is asking her for gift cards instead of gifts and then buy your children the gifts yourself you your husband the your kids are your immediate family now have your husband tell her hat next christmas you guys will host go ahead and discuss amongst yourselves food options so that you will have that ready when it comes up suggest you split the cooking or whatever we do finger foods for christmas sausage balls cheese crackers deviled eggs veggie tray pig in the blankets bean salad fruit and desert type stuff and we host it way more important to me that we have fun christmas than food heavy traveled filled one remember it okay to say no do what did and say having christmas in our own house this year we will see you either just before or on boxing day just have christmas with just you your partner and the little ones my mil used to buy each kid at least shit toys for christmas and their birthday even with list that gave her so one year let the kids play with toy and made sure all of the other toys remained in their individual packaging saying oh we already have one of those she asked me what was going to do with the unopened toys and told her would donate them to toys for tots she kept them and returned them herself she no longer buys shit toys you and husband are going to going to have to put your foot down and tell her you re doing santa at your home you might be right but there is not much you can do about that bet she is in it for the immediate gratification she will get from seeing the kids eyes light up when they see the plastic crap toys removed they re gifts you need to suck it up grow up and be grateful she is and so are you the question is who is better behaved you or her that said you do have to have xmas at her house there will probably be blowback if you announce change of plans so be prepared part of growing up finally and having kids is learning how to deal with blowback from other adults having good manners is not equivalent to sacrificing everything you want to keep others from being disappointed you get to decide how you celebrate christmas two years does not tradition make and getting two young kids and all their crap together to go over there is ridiculous if you do want to be doing it have your husband tell her now no two months in advance is not too late that she is invited to your house for insert festivities on insert days times and you will be doing insert festivities at your home as family this year if she is invited to everything fine if not fine it is not rude to make your own plans and invite her when it suits you even if this tradition had been ongoing for thirty years it still your perogative to say thanks but no thanks to her invitation this year as far as the junky plastic crap toys we have the same problem when she ask what to get the kids have an amazon wishlist all set up when she asks if specific toys would be good explain why or why not we still get the same junky plastic crap that the kids might enjoy for couple of months if it does break first ve learned to just say thanks and let it go and chuck it when it breaks sometimes the crap she gives us becomes grandma house toy so she can see how it feels to have plastic junk take over her house otherwise there is no solution that is ungrateful and rude here what did with my mil and my own family once we had kids christmas is at our house full stop if anyone wants to see us christmas day they come here annoying loud horrible toys she welcome to give them to the kids but they live at her house not mine give her all the other holidays she enjoys going overboard on easter specifically comes to mind but christmas is mine the other thing that truly helped me with this was my husband we are on the same page and have been since the birth of our son he helped me set the boundaries and eventually mil got used to it even though it was huge change for her removed ha ha ha thought that is where was do think it too late at all to change tell her you like to do xmas at your house this year as just family maybe offer to visit later in the day as for gifts it bit ridiculous they ask for list and do use it but see nothing malicious there just ignorance maybe say oh were you unable to find such and such from the list think saw it at and stores depending on how they reply you ll better understand the thinking behind the choices they made regarding presents at the end of the day it their decision to gift whatever they like it their money it may be foolish to buy toy that will break and the kid wo enjoy that long but mil gets to make that decision because it her money it not unreasonable to talk to her when you give her the list and say chose and because the brand is really durable or because child really loves ponies right now or because it something the kids will get lots of use out of for years they also have no obligation to pay into college fund for your kids is it infuriating my mil does the same stuff asks for list and never buys anything on it wonder what even bother coming up with list she also spends ton on clothes asking what sizes the kids wear and she always buys the wrong sizes even text it to her so she ca claim she forgot what told her so aggravating they also have contributed to the kids 529 accounts even though education is the most important thing all can suggest is to stay home on christmas day we started this when kids were your kid ages you get to start your own traditions that is the good part of being an adult and parent also remember that they will not buy what you suggest and remind yourself that ultimately it is important it is good way to teach your kids proper manners removed try to remind myself that even though feel irritated and often very rightfully so there are so many people who truly have terrible vicious family members in the end my family loves my kids and try to put it in perspective as someone else stated have tried various methods and come to the conclusion that the behavior wo change try not to let it get to me so this right here my mom asks for lists and then gets whatever she wants and is usually not on the list so accept it for what it is save all the awesome things on the list for you guys when my mom asks for list only give general idea of what the kids are interested in and then she can do whatever she wants as for tradition well you are family you get to create your own traditions now we only go to my parents every other christmas we always invite them down on the year we are home they have yet to come if they lived in town we would do our own thing in the morning first and then go over there or they come over that is what we do with my in laws on the year we are home as for the savings if family or friends give the kiddos money put it in there but unless they asked you to set something up so they can put money in personally would not be expecting any best of luck we do christmas eve at the mil house and christmas day at home decide what you want to do and lay it out for her kindly but clearly and do waver on the gift thing would stop giving her lists and accept her gifts graciously and donate what you do want in the home have also said that will be perfect toy to keep at grandma house for when we visit for those toys that will not have in my house deleted do agree that she should have to adhere to list for christmas presents or that anyone should she honestly bought toy specifically because she cares and thought it would bring them joy how do your children feel about the presents hope on their end at least that they genuinely feel thankful and that they say it it the same for people who become so enraged when people do buy directly off their baby registry why be so salty when someone went out of their way to do something nice saying this out of honesty there are children who do get much for christmas and other holidays or have family members who do even care to give them presents just do buy into that mindset that it such terrible thing if you hate the toys that much toy can always donate them to kids that will appreciate them also be mortified asking my mother or mil to pay for any of my kids college do send her gift list she ca piss you off if you do give her any ammo do address the college savings plan either it will just come across as begging for money and if she ca even manage to buy them decent gifts when she asks you to send her list there no way in hell she going to take that well or do anything about it basically lower your expectations as in have none this year tell her that christmas will be at your house on day at time invite her but make sure she knows that this is christmas for you and your kids this year and that you wo be coming to second christmas at her house or anyone else if they come fine if not whatever think this is the only way me too did similar thing then started keeping the toys grandma bought at her house for my kid to play with when we were there she stopped getting the annoying toys that made lots of sounds or had tons of parts or broke easily leave the shitty toys at her house for them to play with it works for us if you are way too passive and nice sounds like you know what you need to do time to work on those things being passive and nice is inherently bad but you do need to be able to advocate for your family we have an almost two year old and another baby due soonish we always went to mil for christmas and cookie party before that and did not really enjoy them most of the time very stressful she moved out of state and last year holidays were miserable and her halloween party this year was absolutely miserable for all three of us my husband and talked about what we wanted our future to look like for future holidays we want to see our family if possible but want to stay closer to home than mil house we do want our kids miserable for holidays and we are ready to make the call for them even though we were for ourselves we agreed on what we wanted we agreed on talking to mil together in person about it we tried to reassure her that we love her and want to be with her and our decision about what was best for our family had nothing to do with how much we love her it went poorly and we are still dealing with some of the fallout mil and one sil think ve brainwashed my husband and the other sil because encouraged us to communicate advocate for ourselves and be respectful about it people who are disrespectful of others or just people who are very used to certain tradition will always be upset at things changing or you asking to be respected it sucks but there no way around doing it if you want to be not miserable from being disrespected for years the bottom line is that your family comes first being assertive is hard when you do know how to do it and have no practice but you can do it and you will get through any drama that results assume best intentions my inlaws love plastic electronic toys because back in the day those were the expensive type of toys they could buy for their kids now they have disposable income and they want to treat their grandchild it possible that your mil is trying to disregard your lists maybe she thinks she upgrading it there already lot of good advice in here about claiming the holiday leaving toys at grandma house etc but also see lot of ultimatums and such and it seems like that little much it would be awesome if they wanted to contribute to the 529 but these are gifts you do get to mandate what is given easier convo is please let me know if you get anything from the list so know not to duplicate thanks deleted have to agree here unfortunately we love contributions to her college education fund but instead get expensive girly clothing that is dealt to our taste and that our lo can probably only wear few times unfortunately think we just have to deal with it lot of people gift thinking about what they derive pleasure from everyone loves buying cute baby clothing except me giving money to college fund is super sensible but does give that jolt of pleasure from seeing baby wear something cute or play with something you chose sad but true we keep unwanted gifts in their original boxes and either sell regift or donate once my parents aunts and uncles started having kids we did christmas as such christmas morning was spent at our individual homes santa came to our houses then after breakfast presents church we all headed to grandma and grandpa for more presents and an early dinner if you and your husband want to do christmas at your house just say so tell her were doing christmas as family at our home this year consider offering to come over in the afternoon or on christmas eve you do have to do that though you ca control other people nice way to change where you spend christmas is to simply say you re going to spend it as family at your own place and have an idea of when you could spend some time with them no idea how close far they live from you in terms of presents just be thankful she wants to get your children stuff when you say she gets age inappropriate toys does she buy things too young or too old she may just be excited about the toy and not realise your child is too young for it or perhaps in her eyes her grandchildren are young and would like the toy if she buying to old perhaps say something like wow that looks fun child will have fun with that in few months years if she buying too young it bit trickier but perhaps quiet word when she asks for the list that your kids have moved on from xyz and perhaps might like something that they ll enjoy for while as for not contributing to their education funds she probably thinks it long way off and is as fun and grandparents want to be fun if you really do like her gifts you could return or sell them and put the money away might spend too much time on justnomil but this sounds like something my mil would do to annoy me you ca make people put away money for your kids to go to college but if she has list of things your kids want need and she asked for that list there no reason for her to stray from it definitely start making her gifts you do want at home toys that stay at grandma also it not too late to tell her christmas is at your house this year so you and hubby need to get on the same page to make that happen from now on sure you and the kids will feel more comfortable celebrating at home and they ll probably like santa coming to their home instead of grandma edits because tired and apparently ca type wow thank you that was something really needed to hear think lot of your complaints are valid especially spending christmas at your house but in complete disagreement about the 529 contribution kids do enjoy receiving money for college for christmas that gift is more for you as parent if you re planning on paying for college than it is for the kid grandparents like giving gifts that bring joy to their grandkids do you honestly think your kids wish there were more in their 529s that even less fun than getting socks also your mil is asking for gift *ideas* but ultimately unless she violating some boundaries that you ve told her about no plastic crap part of the joy of gift giving is her picking out what she wants my mother who loves my year old said college money that so boring when told her that the only thing he needed for his birthday and xmas perhaps you can request gift receipt return anything do want in my house noisy toys agree with you about the college fund but do think it too late to change the christmas tradition if no set plans have been made it six weeks way still time to let her know is the tradition that you want to change the location of christmas or that she buys the santa gifts gt sometimes the crap she gives us becomes grandma house toy so she can see how it feels to have plastic junk take over her house otherwise there is no solution that is ungrateful and rude this is great bit of advice reckon you could warn her that you ahead of time that you do have space for anything big but if she sees something she really likes then it fine to keep it at her house and the kids can play with it there gt do agree that she should have to adhere to list for christmas presents or that anyone should totally true but at the same time do ask for list if you know you re not going to follow it yes could agree with this more make wish lists every year too stopped getting upset when mil and my own mother go off said lists and get annoying crap for my kid he their grandchild and ca control everything they do you will become much much happier when you let things like this go and it will make them happier and less stubborn about things that may matter little more one of the absolute key things to surviving difficult mil is learning to choose your battles and learning when to let things go this is absolutely great advice so good they re words ve had to live by because my own parents pull all kinds of crap when stopped trying to control the outcome rely on them to do anything the way expect our relationship improved dramatically and in turn they ve stopped trying to tell me what you do because they know wo listen some people are just like that my parents always ask for lists and never follow them most irritating they ll buy things super similar and the same price but not the actual thing requested so do give lists anymore they ve asked for my daughter 529 account info to make contribution ve send it 3x and no deposits not that expect them to follow through as someone said upthread my expectations are zero so never disappointed in the same boat sort of but do want to upset anyone and do really mind the traveling for christmas we do santa at our house though and then say that santa dropped other toys off at grandmas for him and his cousins lot of that stays there as for the list have wishlist for my son with about 30 fun open ended educational toys and my mom immediately said they re all boring so ve decided to add one or two fun flashy toys that can tolerate if she going to spend money rather it be on something sort of okay your mil does have to give your kids darn thing it your job to save and send them to college it your job to provide whatever kind of toys you want them playing with do like what mil gives donate it to charity after the holidays be grateful she loves your little ones enough to go shopping for them feel the same way about the plastic junk my inlaws give to my kids but you know what my kids have fun opening the gifts my inlaws have fun shopping for them and again they do *need* to buy them anything but it nice that they care enough to whenever birthday or holiday is coming up pack box for goodwill to make room for whatever comes next agree with you hate that you got downvoted gifts are not mandatory and entirely up to the gift giver sounds like someone should get lump of coal this year and do mean mil thank you solid advice and definitely need to set some boundaries list is there for general idea not exactly to follow it besides that it not even the first time op has posted about lists and registries she makes them for birthdays as well it seems to me she just wants to control what people buy for her kids and seemingly gets annoyed when they do follow her lists edit some words yep same thing here since both of our parents are within driving distance we are happy to come out later on christmas day or the day after but christmas morning with santa etc is at our house we ve also said they re welcome to come here if they want to see all the waking up and discovering gifts thing but so far neither set of grandparents has taken us up on the offer speak up make sure santa comes to your house too we usually do christmas morning at our house opening all the santa and mama papa gifts and then mid morning we go to grandpa buy all the presents you want for your kids and be grateful for whatever she gets or else ask for no gifts you ca *make* people buy stuff you are *asking* also for the 529 savings plan my mom set one of these up and from that year on never received gift from my grandparents again all they did was contribute 50 to the savings plan christmas and birthdays for kid terrible gift was disappointed every year think these things should be separate from gifts agree with your mother it is boring my grandparents stopped giving presents and only starting contributing to my college savings and hated it it was super disappointing as kid to never get gift from my grandparents christmas and birthdays think that sort of thing should be separate or in addition to gift devinesigns pretty much covers everything you need to know do my addition is to tell mil that with two kids of your own and the oldest becoming more aware you want to have your own christmas *at your house* like ds said if you do mind invite mil to join you for christmas or offer to go to her house later in the day or even do christmas at mils on christmas eve end up with house full of people my mom comes down christmas eve and my unmarried brothers sleep over too my inlaws live only few miles away so they come for breakfast and to witness santa cook breakfast lunch and dinner but wo leave my house christmas day we are the only ones with kids so the way we see it everyone else is hell of lot more mobile than we are thankfully get along very well with my inlaws and my husband loves my family he hangs out with my brothers regularly if there was conflict might be more reluctant to host as fellow complainer of the why do they even ask if they do care variety of gift giver actually asking for list and then disregarding it is something feel uncomfortable about when my oldest turned and we suddenly moved much closer to my in laws put my foot down that santa claus absolutely comes to our house not the grandparents said it was really important for when she started talking to her friends about it but was also honest about how important it was for me never got to do santa as child so doing it for the first time ever with my own children and get to make these rules the grandparents got to raise their own kids and now it my turn and said so possibly in gentler language the key is not to care if there are hurt feelings this is important for you and your family also tell your mil when she inevitably asks for the xmas list how frustrating it is for you to put in the work of making list when she never seems to even consult it thanks it okay knew was going to be downvoted but figured be mom about manners and used to downvotes from my kids about homework bedtime screen use in laws are not your personal bank for one thing so you do get to choose where they put their money and being brat about what they give your kids is setting pretty bad example for said kids it just nasty and meanspirited wish our extended family would read this thread my in laws are pretty insistent that they want us and all grandkids to stay at their house christmas eve so they can give santa presents my sister is single without kids and lives 5+ hours away from the rest of our family and she always complains that no one comes to visit her and just because she single does mean she should always be the one who has to travel um ya okay ll pack up my family of five with three under plus dogs and drive hours to go try to fit adults and kids into tiny bedrooms have the kids each make an amazon wishlist for bdays and christmas have found that ca force them to buy from it because what they do with their money is their own business but at the same time they ca force me to keep any of it because what do with my house and precious limited storage space is my own business so deal with the gifts for the day and donate what we do want to keep if they have complaint stick firmly to if you do stick to the list ca promise it going to work with our family lifestyle but we still have to be gracious about it thank yous are must put smile on but do feel obligated to make the stuff stickh around you should say anything to her your husband needs too id also make sure he leaves your name out of it when talks to her if you re looking for way to remain passive and get what you want it is going to happen but your husband should be going to bat for the both of you on this one since it his mother it is unreasonable for you guys to want to host in our family the ones with the kids make the rules for holidays because it about making it good for them more than anyone else you and your husband can say we re staying home this year and we love to have you guys come over few hours if you have other plans or come for the whole day we love to have you guys here if she wants to see you guys she ll come she might crank about it at first but if she shows up and gives it real shot that the important part the questions at the end you are being little ungrateful because the main thing is whether or not she being good grandma she might not do it your way but is she good to the kids you can sell off donate lot of the plastic crap we slide ours right into tote in the closet at the end of the day on christmas and they never miss it do shrug it off make plan and stick to it and as for the college plan you ca force her to pay into it that is what brings her joy and it her money just let that part of it go guess that the thing op is just asking for people to buy off list mil is asking for list and ignoring it key distinction so much this try to do this with my mil but tend to not see it through new years resolution my family my way yes this you are the adult so you get to make your own choices about how you interact with other people there are always consequences for the choices you make op not happy in her current situation because she chosen the less confrontational path but if she does confront mil she is choosing to make waves which choice is the best one the one that gives you the best long term solution in my opinion setting boundaries and standing up for yourself is nearly always the best long term solution
